# Example Customizations for GitHub Pages

This file contains example configurations you can copy to `page-config.yml` to customize your GitHub Pages.

## Example 1: Minimalist Style

```yaml
site:
  title: "ğŸ“š Lecture Archive"
  welcome_message: "Browse and download course materials."
  footer_text: "Auto-generated"
  license_text: "CC BY-NC 4.0"

categories:
  - name: "General Physics"
    patterns:
      - "^gp.*\\.pdf$"
  
  - name: "Policies"
    patterns:
      - ".*(grading|submission|generative|policy|guideline).*\\.pdf$"
  
  - name: "Other"
    patterns:
      - ".*\\.pdf$"

display:
  show_file_sizes: false
  show_version_badges: true
  version_badge_text: "Current"
  old_version_badge_text: "Archive"

style:
  primary_color: "#2188ff"
  background_color: "#ffffff"
  card_background: "#f6f8fa"
```

## Example 2: Dark Theme

```yaml
site:
  title: "ğŸŒ™ Lecture Materials"
  welcome_message: "Dark mode archive for comfortable nighttime studying."
  footer_text: "Generated by GitHub Actions"
  license_text: "Licensed under <a href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/\">CC BY-NC 4.0</a>"

categories:
  - name: "General Physics"
    icon: "ğŸ“"
    patterns:
      - "^gp.*\\.pdf$"
    description: "Physics lecture materials"
  
  - name: "Course Policies"
    icon: "ğŸ“‹"
    patterns:
      - ".*(grading|submission|generative|policy|guideline).*\\.pdf$"
    description: "Important course information"
  
  - name: "Resources"
    icon: "ğŸ“š"
    patterns:
      - ".*\\.pdf$"

display:
  show_file_sizes: true
  show_version_badges: true
  version_badge_text: "Latest"
  old_version_badge_text: "Old"

style:
  primary_color: "#58a6ff"
  background_color: "#0d1117"
  card_background: "#161b22"
```

Note: For a full dark theme, you'll also need to edit `.github/templates/index.html.j2` to change text colors to light colors. Add these CSS rules:

```css
body { color: #c9d1d9; }
h1, h2 { color: #c9d1d9; border-color: #30363d; }
.category-description { color: #8b949e; }
.pdf-name { color: #58a6ff; }
.pdf-size { color: #8b949e; }
.footer { color: #8b949e; border-color: #21262d; }
```

## Example 3: Detailed Categorization

```yaml
site:
  title: "Lecture Materials - PDF Archive"
  welcome_message: "Welcome! Find all course materials organized by topic and type."
  footer_text: "Last updated by GitHub Actions"
  license_text: "Licensed under <a href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/\">CC BY-NC 4.0</a>"

categories:
  - name: "General Physics - Bootcamp Series"
    icon: "ğŸš€"
    patterns:
      - "^gp.*boot.*\\.pdf$"
    description: "Foundational bootcamp materials for General Physics"
  
  - name: "General Physics - Main Course"
    icon: "ğŸ“"
    patterns:
      - "^gp(?!.*boot).*\\.pdf$"
    description: "Main lecture materials for General Physics"
  
  - name: "Grading & Assessment"
    icon: "âœ…"
    patterns:
      - ".*grading.*\\.pdf$"
    description: "Information about course grading policies"
  
  - name: "Submission Guidelines"
    icon: "ğŸ“¤"
    patterns:
      - ".*submission.*\\.pdf$"
    description: "How to submit assignments and projects"
  
  - name: "Course Policies"
    icon: "ğŸ“‹"
    patterns:
      - ".*(policy|guideline|generative).*\\.pdf$"
    description: "General course policies and guidelines"
  
  - name: "Additional Resources"
    icon: "ğŸ“š"
    patterns:
      - ".*\\.pdf$"
    description: "Supplementary materials and references"

display:
  show_file_sizes: true
  show_version_badges: true
  version_badge_text: "Latest Version"
  old_version_badge_text: "Archived Version"
  sort_by: "name"

style:
  primary_color: "#0366d6"
  background_color: "#f5f5f5"
  card_background: "white"
```

## Tips for Creating Your Own

1. **Start with the default** - Copy the current `page-config.yml` and modify incrementally
2. **Test regex patterns** - Use [regex101.com](https://regex101.com) with Python flavor
3. **Order matters** - Files match the first category pattern that succeeds
4. **Use catch-all last** - Put `".*\\.pdf$"` in your last category to catch everything
5. **Icons are optional** - Emojis work great, but you can omit the icon field
6. **Test locally first** - Run the generator script to test before pushing
